name: Suitcase
body:
## Getting started

Please note, suitcase only runs on ruby >= 1.9.

```shell
$ gem install suitcase
```

In your Gemfile:

```ruby
gem 'suitcase'
```

## Basics

### Configuration

```ruby
Suitcase.configure do |config|
  config.hotel_api_key = "your_api_key_here"
  config.hotel_cid = "55505"
end
```

### Usage

```ruby
hotel = Suitcase::Hotel.find(id: 123904)
```

Here, `hotel` is a `Suitcase::Hotel` object the has the schema defined [here](https://github.com/thoughtfusion/suitcase/wiki/User-flow).

Also, consider checking out the [User flow](https://github.com/thoughtfusion/suitcase/wiki/User-flow) page on the wiki for information on using the gem in a real-world setting.

# Contributing

If you make any changes to suitcase, please consider creating a pull request to the main repository if the request meets the following requirements:

1. Well-tested (I use RSpec, may be moving over to minitest soon)
2. Well-styled as much as possible ([GitHub's Ruby Styleguide](https://github.com/styleguide/ruby))
3. Compliant (it should feel like the already existing code).
